dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Vicia{/it}) of herbaceous twining leguminous plants including some grown for fodder and green manure {dx}compare {dxt|crown vetch||}, {dxt|hairy vetch||}, {dxt|milk vetch||}{/dx}

et: Middle English {it}fecche, veche{/it}, from Middle French dialect (Norman & Picard) {it}veche{/it}, from Latin {it}vicia{/it}; perhaps akin to Latin {it}vincire{/it} to bind
shortdef: any of a genus (Vicia) of herbaceous twining leguminous plants including some grown for fodder and green manure

dt: {bc}a Eurasian herb ({it}Coronilla varia{/it}) of the legume family that is naturalized in the eastern U.S. and has umbels of pink-and-white flowers and sharp-angled pods

shortdef: a Eurasian herb (Coronilla varia) of the legume family that is naturalized in the eastern U.S. and has umbels of pink-and-white flowers and sharp-angled pods

dt: {bc}a Eurasian vetch ({it}Vicia villosa{/it}) extensively cultivated as a cover and early forage crop

shortdef: a Eurasian vetch (Vicia villosa) extensively cultivated as a cover and early forage crop

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Astragalus{/it}) of annual or perennial leguminous herbs of north temperate regions

et: from the popular belief that it increases the milk yield of goats
shortdef: any of a genus (Astragalus) of annual or perennial leguminous herbs of north temperate regions
